subject: Colleges and Universities
lead_paragraph: The billionaire T. Boone Pickens will give another $63 million to Oklahoma State to finish athletic projects that were supposed to be paid for with a $165 million donation that took a hit during the economic downturn. Pickens’s $165 million donation, announced in January 2006, was the largest gift to a college athletic program. He intended to increase it through his investments so it would pay for an estimated $420 million in renovations and new construction on the campus. That plan was going smoothly until Pickens’s BP Capital energy encountered financial trouble in recent months.
